means: （使）成为固体，（使）变硬，（使）变得坚固( solidify的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Her behavior this week has solidified her support within the Department of Justice.
sentence.Network_cn: 她本周的行为使司法部成员坚定了对她的支持。

sentence.Network_en: Her attitudes solidified through privilege and habit.
sentence.Network_cn: 由于特权和习惯使然，她的看法变得越来越难以改变。

sentence.Network_en: When threatened, he fires spheres of solidified air from his launcher!
sentence.Network_cn: 当危险来临, 他就会发射它的弹药!

entry.def: When a liquid solidifies or is solidified, it changes into a solid.

example.ex: The thicker lava would have taken two weeks to solidify...
example.tran: 较厚的熔岩需要两周的时间才能凝固。

example.ex: The Energy Department plans to solidify the deadly waste in a high-tech billion-dollar factory.
example.tran: 能源部计划在造价几十亿美元的高科技工厂里将那些致命的废料固态化。

entry.tran: 巩固;(使)变可靠;(使)变稳固
entry.def: If something such as a position or opinion solidifies, or if something solidifies it, it becomes firmer and more definite and unlikely to change.

example.ex: Her attitudes solidified through privilege and habit.
example.tran: 由于特权和习惯使然,她的看法变得越来越难以改变。

example.ex: ...his attempt to solidify his position as chairman...
example.tran: 他为巩固自己的主席地位所作的努力

auth_sentence.content: Have they solidified? Refrigerate the jars overnight.
auth_sentence.res_content: Have they solidified? Refrigerate the jars overnight.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Have they solidified? Refrigerate the jars overnight.

auth_sentence.content: The spill may have solidified the opposition.
auth_sentence.res_content: The spill may have solidified the opposition.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The spill may have solidified the opposition.

auth_sentence.content: Or fantasy has become solidified as fact, the dream as daylight.
auth_sentence.res_content: Or fantasy has become solidified as fact, the dream as daylight.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Or fantasy has become solidified as fact, the dream as daylight.
